A

AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter
Abstract base class for filtering a column based on a timerange and number of versions, specifically meant to implement the column selection functionality of the Query Planner.
AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter() - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
 
AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter(int) - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
Create a filter based on the maximum number of versions with a maximal timerange.
AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter(int, long, long) - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.AbstractColumnVersionTimerangeFilter
Create a filter based on the maximum number of versions and a timerange to check.
AbstractKeyValueSelector - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector
An abstract base class for Selectors that focus on the key/value only.
AbstractKeyValueSelector() - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector.AbstractKeyValueSelector
 
AbstractRowSelector - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector
An abstract base class for making Selectors that are based only on the row key
AbstractRowSelector() - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector.AbstractRowSelector
 
AbstractStatelessSelector - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector
A base class to extend when the Selector you want to write has no state and thus does not need specific implementations of the Writable methods.
AbstractStatelessSelector() - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.selector.AbstractStatelessSelector
 
ATTEMPT_LOCAL_LOAD_FIRST - Static variable in class com.opower.hadoop.fs.HdfsClassLoader
A configuration option to indicate whether or not to skip the standard ClassLoader hierarchical search and look at the configured jar first.

Utility classes for dealing with HDFS.

A collection of HBase Filters to make selecting data in HBase easier.

Examples of how to use the various filters in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.

Examples of how to use the HBase query functionality in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.query.

An abstraction from HBase's native Filter that inverts the contract.

DefaultQuery - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.query
Default implementation of a Query, which collaborates with the DefaultQueryPlanner
DefaultQueryPlanner - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.query
A default implementation of the QueryPlanner that is the main entry-point for running queries against HBase.

DEPLOY_FILTER_PATH - Static variable in class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.DeployedFilterManager
A configuration option to specify the base directory where jars will be copied to in HDFS temporarily.
DeployedFilter - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter
Acts as a wrapper around another Filter allowing for that filter to be dynamically deployed into an HBase cluster.

Required default constructor for serialization

DeployedFilterManager - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter
Responsible for managing the lifecycle of a DeployedFilter and, more importantly, the Filter it wraps.
DeployedFilterManager(Configuration) - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.DeployedFilterManager
Since the DeployedFilterManager writes a jar file to HDFS, it needs to have access to a Configuration
deployFilter(Filter) - Method in class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.filter.DeployedFilterManager
Deploys a Filter to the HBase cluster by finding the jar file the class is defined in and copying it to a location in HDFS.

HBaseTestRunner - Class in com.opower.hadoop.hbase.test
A JUnit runner that boots up a MiniHBaseCluster for the lifespan of all tests that are run, thus allowing you to take the performance penalty of booting the cluster once instead of with each test class that is run.
HBaseTestRunner(Class<?>) - Constructor for class com.opower.hadoop.hbase.test.HBaseTestRunner
